rules.natural: If the TV network broadcast is interrupted, then a public alert has been sent.
Whenever the storm track prediction has improved, the forecast model has been updated.
Either the emergency signal transmission is blocked, or the operator has enabled manual override, or the power grid is stable.
Under the condition that system maintenance is scheduled, the emergency signal transmission is not blocked.
Either system maintenance is scheduled, or the alerts test mode is active.
If the alerts test mode is active, then a drill simulation is running.

Provided that satellite data verification has passed, then either data quality review is finished, or radar data analysis is complete, or if satellite feed data has been received, then under the condition that the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.
If sensor network cross-check has been done, then if satellite feed data has been received, then whenever the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.
Either the model forecast is reliable, or if the satellite data is accurate, then the radar is not sensor malfunctioning.

Under the condition that radar network validation has been performed, then provided that satellite feed data has been received, then if the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.
If the server system is operational, then the model forecast is not reliable.
If a tornado warning has been issued, then if the generator backup is active, the station does not have a power outage.
Under the condition that a public alert has been sent, then if the generator backup is active, the station does not have a power outage.
Whenever an emergency protocol has been executed, a tornado warning has been issued.
Either an emergency protocol has been executed, or the TV network broadcast is interrupted.

Provided that it is not the case that either radar data analysis is complete or if satellite feed data has been received, then under the condition that the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct, then the storm track prediction has improved.
If it is not the case that if a drill simulation is running, then the emergency signal transmission is not blocked, then staff confusion has occurred.
Under the condition that it is not the case that if a drill simulation is running, then the emergency signal transmission is not blocked, then staff confusion has not occurred.
Provided that it is not the case that either equipment repair is completed or it is not the case that the station has a power outage, then the system has passed inspection.
If it is not the case that either the backup generator has been fueled or it is not the case that the station power has been restored, then the generator has been supplied with fuel.
Under the condition that it is not the case that either sensor network cross-check has been done or radar network validation has been performed, then a discrepancy has been found in the measurements.
Provided that it is not the case that either sensor network cross-check has been done or radar network validation has been performed, then a discrepancy has not been found in the measurements.
If it is not the case that if the generator backup is active, then the station does not have a power outage, then the station power has been restored.
If the power grid is not stable, then the radar is sensor malfunctioning.
Under the condition that the power grid is not stable, then the station has a power outage.
If the power grid is not stable, then the storm path prediction is not correct.

(A10 → A8).natural: If the TV network broadcast is interrupted, then a public alert has been sent.

(A12 → (¬G → A11)).natural: Provided that satellite feed data has been received, then in case the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.

(A13 ∨ (A12 → (¬G → A11))).natural: Either radar data analysis is complete, or if satellite feed data has been received, then under the condition that the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.

(A15 → A14).natural: Whenever the storm track prediction has improved, the forecast model has been updated.

(A16 ∨ G).natural: Either the operator has enabled manual override, or the power grid is stable.

(A17 ∨ (A16 ∨ G)).natural: Either the emergency signal transmission is blocked, or the operator has enabled manual override, or the power grid is stable.

(A18 → ¬A17).natural: Under the condition that system maintenance is scheduled, the emergency signal transmission is not blocked.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: Either system maintenance is scheduled, or the alerts test mode is active.

(A20 → ¬A17).natural: Whenever a drill simulation is running, the emergency signal transmission is not blocked.

(A25 ∨ ¬A24).natural: Either the backup generator has been fueled, or it is not the case that the station power has been restored.

(A27 ∨ (A13 ∨ (A12 → (¬G → A11)))).natural: Either data quality review is finished, or radar data analysis is complete, or if satellite feed data has been received, then given that the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.

(A28 → (A27 ∨ (A13 ∨ (A12 → (¬G → A11))).natural: Provided that satellite data verification has passed, then either data quality review is finished, or radar data analysis is complete, or if satellite feed data has been received, then under the condition that the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.

(A29 → (A12 → (¬G → A11))).natural: If sensor network cross-check has been done, then if satellite feed data has been received, then whenever the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.

(A29 ∨ A30).natural: Either sensor network cross-check has been done, or radar network validation has been performed.

(A3 ∨ (A2 → ¬A1)).natural: Either the model forecast is reliable, or if the satellite data is accurate, then the radar is not sensor malfunctioning.

(A30 → (A12 → (¬G → A11))).natural: Under the condition that radar network validation has been performed, then provided that satellite feed data has been received, then if the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct.

(A4 → ¬A3).natural: If the server system is operational, then the model forecast is not reliable.

(A6 → ¬A5).natural: Provided that the generator backup is active, then the station does not have a power outage.

(A7 → (A6 → ¬A5)).natural: If a tornado warning has been issued, then if the generator backup is active, the station does not have a power outage.

(A8 → (A6 → ¬A5)).natural: Under the condition that a public alert has been sent, then if the generator backup is active, the station does not have a power outage.

(A9 ∨ A10).natural: Either an emergency protocol has been executed, or the TV network broadcast is interrupted.

(¬(A13 ∨ (A12 → (¬G → A11))) → A14).natural: If it is not the case that either radar data analysis is complete or if satellite feed data has been received, then provided that the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct, then the forecast model has been updated.

(¬(A13 ∨ (A12 → (¬G → A11))) → A15).natural: Provided that it is not the case that either radar data analysis is complete or if satellite feed data has been received, then under the condition that the power grid is not stable, the storm path prediction is correct, then the storm track prediction has improved.

(¬(A20 → ¬A17) → A21).natural: If it is not the case that if a drill simulation is running, then the emergency signal transmission is not blocked, then staff confusion has occurred.

(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A31).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that either sensor network cross-check has been done or radar network validation has been performed, then a discrepancy has been found in the measurements.

(¬(A6 → ¬A5) → A24).natural: If it is not the case that if the generator backup is active, then the station does not have a power outage, then the station power has been restored.
